channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 09/11/24
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2024/11/09/something-for-the-weekend-09-11-24/

There’s a busy weekend ahead of staring at gameplay capture and trying to figure out what’s different and improved. My very first impression going from PS5 to PS5 Pro has been that Insomniac are wizards at blending art direction and graphics to get the most out of a console.

Has anyone else got a PS5 Pro in the house?

In the News This Week

  • Nintendo finally confirms Switch 2 backward compatibility
  • Death Stranding just sauntered onto Xbox Series X|S
  • Warhammer 40,000: Darktide washes onto PS5 in December
  • Sony confirm the 55 PS5 Pro enhanced games for launch
  • Dragon Age: The Veilguard will not get any expansions
  • Take-Two sells Private Division label to a secret new owner
  • Amplitude Studios goes independent and splits off from Sega
  • SEGA Classics to be delisted from digital stores on December 6th
  • Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown players to get free Porsche and stickers
  • November’s Game Pass update includes Metal Slug Tactics and Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024
  • November’s PS Plus Monthly Games are ready to download

Games in Review & Featured Articles

There’s a major contender for VR Game of the Year out now, with Metro Awakening’s launch. Tuffcub had a great time sneaking through the Moscow Metro system, that’s for sure.

  • Metro Awakening VR – PSVR 2, PC VR, Meta Quest 2 & 3 – 9/10
  • Empire of the Ants – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Dark and Deep – PC – 8/10
  • Mario & Luigi: Brothership – NSW – 7/10
  • Slitterhead – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 6/10
  • Awaken – Astral Blade – PS5, PC – 4/10

Dom also had a review of one of the cutest little controllers you can imagine:

  • CRKD Atom Controller – NSW, iOS, And, PC – 8/10

At the tail end of the week, we finally got our hands on with a PS5 Pro, and started down the path of a review and game comparisons with a PS5 Pro unboxing (with a very special guest star).

I also got to briefly go hands on with the top-down tactical shooter Project ARC, a smaller experiment from PUBG Studios.

Reuben got to sit down and chat about Ys and Trails Through Daybreak with Nihon Falcom’s Toshihiro Kondo.

Rounding things out as always, What We Played featured Slitterhead, Metro Awakening and PS5 Pro in general.

Trailer Park

Apex Legends rolls back the years with Launch Royale mode

No Man’s Sky’s Mass Effect collab is now live

Black Ops 6 Season 1 has launched

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead!
